findings: Small bilateral pleural effusions, right greater than left, new
Abnormal signal within the right lung base may represent atelectasis
Liver is normal in size, with no evidence of diffuse hepatic steatosis or focal hepatic lesions
Portal vein and splenic vein are patent, but dilated
Gallbladder is present with no biliary ductal dilatation
Decreased intrinsic T1 hyperintense signal diffusely within pancreatic parenchyma with surrounding fluid signal and stranding
Pancreatic parenchyma enhances uniformly, with no evidence of pseudoaneurysm
T2 hyperintense nonenhancing foci throughout the pancreatic parenchyma are unchanged in location and number, but some are slightly increased in size compared to prior MRCP
Kidneys atrophic bilaterally, consistent with medical renal disease; T2 hyperintense nonenhancing foci compatible with cysts
No suspicious renal lesions or lymphadenopathy
No suspicious osseous lesions, diffuse anasarca
changes_over_time: The largest pseudocyst in the head of the pancreas increased in size from 15 x 11 mm to 16 x 15 mm
A smaller lesion in the head/uncinate process increased in size from 6 x 5 mm to 11 x 7 mm
Splenomegaly decreased from 15.5 cm to 14.6 cm
